body.p: If a tumor develops in a parathyroid gland it can cause the gland to continuously release high levels of parathyroid hormone (called hyperparathyroidism). What impact, if any, would you expect hyperparathyroidism to have on the skeletal system?

response.feedback: Correct. Hyperparathyroidism leads to excessive amounts of calcium being removed from bone, making them weak. It can also lead to problems in nervous and muscular function because of the high plasma calcium levels the result from this condition.
Incorrect. Parathyroid hormone stimulates calcium loss from bone. This would not make them stronger
Incorrect. Parathyroid hormone levels can have significant impact on bones
Incorrect. Over a long period of time this might occur, but it is secondary to weaker bones, which often leads to fracture.

part.hint: Think about the effect that parathyroid hormone has on bone.
